clinical_study.brief_title: The Role of Transpapillary Stenting in the Treatment of Bile Leakage After Liver Transection.
clinical_study.official_title: The Role of Transpapillary Stenting in the Treatment of Bile Leakage After Liver Transection.

brief_summary.textblock: Bile leakage after liver transection is treated by external drainage. The question addressed is whether downstream control by transpapillary stent insertion into distal bile duct can enhance healing.

detailed_description.textblock: All patients who present with clinically significant bile leakage after liver resection at postoperative day two or longer are offered the opportunity to become randomized to either continuous external drainage or the addition of transpapillary stent.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Number of days of bile leakage from the abdominal cavity
primary_outcome.time_frame: From intervention until day discharge from hospital

secondary_outcome.measure: General complications rates. Postoperative hospital stay
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From intervention until day of discharge from hospital

arm_group.description: External drainage + transpapillary plastic stent (7-10 Fr).

intervention.description: Duodenoscopy plus transpapillary bile cannulation plus stent insertion.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Liver resection including at least two liver segments.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Hepatobiliary digestive anastomosis.
